boardgame.name: Ponte del Diavolo
boardgame.description: Ponte del Diavolo by Martin Ebel is a game that honors both game designer Alex Randolph and Twixt, one of Randolph's most enduring designs._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In this tactical 2-player placement game (ostensibly set in Venice, but this is an abstract), players place wooden squares to build _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot;islands_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_amp;quot; and then attempt to connect them with bridges. Sounds simple, but it's not. With strict rules governing island size and bridge placement, Ponte del Diavolo becomes a tight game of positioning. Much like Randolph's Twixt, the need to think several moves ahead is critical to out-maneuvering your opponent._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;In honour of the late Alex Randolph (1922 - 2004), who passed away in Venice, there is a picture of him on the box of the game._T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;Online Play_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Boardspace.net real time, AI option_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Yucata (turn-based)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;a target='_blank' href=_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;http://www.brettspielnetz.de_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; rel=_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;nofollow_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;http://www.brettspielnetz.de_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;/a_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; (German: turn based on a bigger board: 12x12) direct link_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; Jijbent.nl (Dutch: turn based on a bigger board: 12x12)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt; YourTurnMyTurn.com (English: turn based on a bigger board: 12x12)_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_lt;br/_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_gt;

Rio Grande Games (RIO 316) Number of players: 2-6 Age of players: 10+ Length: 30 minutes Game Description: With _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Ponte del Diavolo_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; Martin Ebel honors Alex Randolph’s most famous game _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Twixt_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; by bringing new elements to this excellent game. In this game, the players build stone bridges over the many canals of Venice. Players score for each successful bridging and for each connected island. Alternative move options and modified target conditions give _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Ponte del Diavolo_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot; its own character, which serves only to remind us more of _T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;Twixt_T_E_M_P_T_A_G_quot;.

Ponte del Diavolo (2007) from Rio Grande Games Box: Box has virtually no shelfwear and only one visible flaw (slight peeling of the paper at one corner). Overall the box is in outstanding condition. Contents: Complete and like new! The pieces have been sorted and stored in plastic bags for convenience and safety -- you will be very happy with how the game is packaged. SHIPPING U.S. shipping will be via USPS Priority Shipping and based on a weight of 2 Lbs. International buyers are very welcome, but please contact me for a shipping price quote to avoid any surprises or misunderstandings.

I have the cheapest prices, so make sure to check out my other available items: http://bit.ly/1zkhMCa # General Information The item comes from a private collection (non-smoking). If you want pictures of the box or have any question in advance, just send me a geekmail or email to baxel@gmx.at , I will usually respond within two business days. # Shipping Shipping costs depend on the size and weight of the package and the destination. Please send me a geekmail or email to baxel@gmx.at with your location so I can respond with the actual shipping cost. # Payment You can pay via PayPal or bank transfer (IBAN/BIC).

I will charge postage based on standard Royal Mail UK or International rates as appropriate. Anyone in, or prepared to travel to, Leicester (Wigston) in the UK is welcome to collect the game in person. Thanks for your interest.
